As an AI language model, I cannot provide information on the most recent trends in this matter, but according to some reports, various studies have shown a positive correlation between knowledge of foreign languages and higher income:

1. A study by The Economist found that American workers who spoke a second language earned an average of 2% more than monolingual workers.

2. A report from the European Commission showed that workers who spoke two or more languages earned on average 10-15% more than those who only spoke one language.

3. A survey by CareerBuilder found that 25% of US employers rewarded bilingual employees with higher wages.

However, it is important to note that correlation does not always equal causation, and a higher income is not solely dependent on language skills. Other factors such as education, experience, and location also play a role in determining income.
